abstract:
Eliminating disagreement in a group is usually beneficial to the social stability. In this
paper, using the well-known Hegselmann-Krause (HK) model, we design a quite simple
strategy that could resolve the opinion difference of the system in finite time and induce the
opinions synchronized to a targeted value. To be specific, we intentionally introduce weak
random noise to only one agent to affect its opinion in the evolution and also a leader agent
with fixed opinion in a divisive group, then strictly prove that the disagreement is finally
eliminated and the opinions get synchronized to the leaderâ€™s opinion in finite time. Other
than that, we calculate the finite stopping time when the opinions synchronously reach the
objective opinion value, which could provide further guide for designing more efficient noise
intervention strategy.
